pr_title: Fix python scripts to be able to run with python3

timeline.bodyText: I assume this is a typo.
timeline.author: yuokada
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -29,7 +29,7 @@ Benchto driver needs to know two things: what benchmark is to be run and what en
 it is to be run on. For the purpose of the following example, we will use `tpch` benchmark
 and Presto server running at `localhost:8080`, with Benchto service running at `localhost:8081`.
 
-Benchto driver uses Sprint Boot to locate environment configuration file, so to pass the
+Benchto driver uses Spring Boot to locate environment configuration file, so to pass the

timeline.bodyText: Could you remove this redundant line?
timeline.author: ebyhr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,7 +59,7 @@ benchmark:
 macros:
   sleep-4s:
     command: echo "Sleeping for 4s" && sleep 4
-      
+

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        new_schema, table, format, source_schema, table))
          
          
            
                          new_schema, table, format, source_schema, table))
timeline.author: ebyhr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -31,7 +31,7 @@
     else:
         raise ValueError(new_schema)
 
-    print 'CREATE SCHEMA hive.%s;' % (new_schema,)
+    print('CREATE SCHEMA hive.{};'.format(new_schema,))
     for table in tables:
-        print 'CREATE TABLE "hive"."%s"."%s" WITH (format = \'%s\') AS SELECT * FROM %s."%s";' % \
-              (new_schema, table, format, source_schema, table)
+        print('CREATE TABLE "hive"."{}"."{}" WITH (format = \'{}\') AS SELECT * FROM {}."{}";'.format(
+            new_schema, table, format, source_schema, table))

timeline.bodyText:
i guess for py 3 just adding (...) for print would be sufficient?
i don't mind the switch to .format, but ideally it would go as a separate change...
since when string#format is supported?
timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -47,7 +47,7 @@
     else:
         raise ValueError(new_schema)
 
-    print 'CREATE SCHEMA hive.%s;' % (new_schema,)
+    print('CREATE SCHEMA hive.{};'.format(new_schema,))

replies.bodyText:
str.format() has been supported from python 2.6.
https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/stdtypes.html#str.format
replies.author: yuokada

timeline.message: Fix scripts to be able to run with python3

Fix README.md

- Replace Sprint boot with Spring boot
- Remove extra spaces

Fix README.md

- Replace Sprint boot with Spring boot
- Remove extra spaces
